Nearest Railway Station: Helem Railway Station (~depends on range); major junctions are Furkating / Golaghat / Nagaon
Nearest Airport: Jorhat Airport (for Central Range) / Tezpur Airport (for Western)
Timings: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM for regular visitor operations
Accessibility: Good roads to major entrances; internal tracks may be rough; not particularly wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Yes — forest department approved guides; safari/elephant ride/jeep safari with permits
Parking: Available at entry gates (e.g. Kohora etc.); charges vary
Nearby Amenities: Lodges, resorts, restaurants in and around Golaghat / Bokakhat
Special Notes: Famous for one-horned rhino; UNESCO World Heritage Site; safari operations sometimes suspended in monsoon

Nearest Bus Stand: Local bus stands in Tezpur region / Rangapar
Timings: Daily operations; park open throughout the day
Accessibility: Access roads up to park entry good; internal trails can be moderate; not very accessible for wheelchair
Guided Tours: Yes – local guides / forest department guides; rafting guides
Parking: Parking available at entry points; small / basic parking
Nearby Amenities: Lodges and guesthouses in Tezpur region; some homestays
Special Notes: Famous for birdwatching; rafting on Jia Bhoroli River; tranquil compared to more crowded parks

Nearest Railway Station: Kamakhya Station (~6-7 km) OR Guwahati Railway Station (~7-8 km)
Nearest Airport: Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport, Guwahati (~20 km)
Timings: Morning: 5:30 AM to ~1:00 PM; Afternoon: ~2:30 PM to ~5:30 PM
Entry Fee: General / free darshan; VIP / special darshan pass ~ ₹500
Best Time to Visit: Oct to Mar; festivals like Ambubachi (June), Durga Puja (Sept/Oct) are major but very crowded
Accessibility: Road access good; hill top requires walk/steep steps; difficult during heavy crowds for mobility-impaired
Guided Tours: Local priests / “pandas” help with darshan process; many guides operate in Guwahati
Parking: Parking available near temple base / on Nilachal Hill; limited during festivals
Nearby Amenities: Hotels in Guwahati; eateries, shops, markets
Special Notes: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas; Ambubachi Mela is biggest festival when temple is closed for 3 days

Type: Natural Lake / Picnic Spot / Eco tourism
Official Website: Assam Tourism pages / Kamrup district site
Nearest Bus Stand: Local bus terminus in Kamrup / Guwahati region
Timings: Open throughout daylight hours; boating etc available seasonally
Entry Fee: Not documented clearly; small boat/rowing charges may apply
Accessibility: Road up to lake region; some forested/uneven paths; not ideal for wheelchair
Guided Tours: Local villagers / tourism services may guide
Parking: Basic parking at lake entry / nearby village; informal or small charges
Nearby Amenities: Basic guesthouses or homestays; local eateries; shops small scale
Special Notes: Lake was formed after 1897 earthquake; cultural festival (Chandubi Festival) in first week of January; migratory birds in winter

Type: National Park / Wildlife Sanctuary / Tiger Reserve
Official Website: Assam Tourism / Manas National Park pages
Nearest Railway Station: Guwahati Railway Station; closer stations like Barpeta Road / Pathsala exist
Nearest Bus Stand: Local bus stands in Barpeta / Manas gate towns
Nearest Airport: Guwahati Airport is major; also closer small airstrips depending on range
Timings: 5:30 AM to 6:30 PM approx visitor hours
Entry Fee: Indians ~ ₹20; Foreigners ~ ₹250; Safari / Jeep fees etc additional
Accessibility: Varies by zone; forests; not wheelchair friendly in many parts
Guided Tours: Yes – wildlife guides, forest dept, safaris, nature walks
Parking: Parking at park entrances; basic facilities
Nearby Amenities: Lodges / eco-tourism rest houses near entrances; towns outside offer more services
Special Notes: UNESCO Biosphere Reserve; dense biodiversity; riverine landscapes; endangered species; cross-border habitat with Bhutan

Nearest Railway Station: Jorhat Railway Station (~approx distance by road + ferry)
Nearest Bus Stand: Bus stand in Jorhat / Nimatighat ferry terminal
Nearest Airport: Jorhat Airport is the closest by flight; then road + ferry
Timings: Accessible year-round when river ferry is operational; ferry timings vary
Entry Fee: Not documented fixed entry fee; Satras may accept donations; boat/ferry charges separately
Accessibility: Access involves road + ferry; river crossings can be affected by monsoon; internal roads may be rural / uneven
Guided Tours: Local guides and tour operators provide cultural tours
Nearby Amenities: Homestays, guesthouses; local eateries; shops; cultural performances
Special Notes: Largest river island in the world; major center of Assamese culture and Satriya tradition

Type: City / Heritage Town / Scenic & Cultural attractions
Nearest Railway Station: Dekargaon Railway Station (~8-14 km) or Rangapara North
Nearest Bus Stand: Tezpur ASTC Bus Station; Mission Chariali Bus Stand
Entry Fee: For many temples free / donation; parks/gardens small admission fees (e.g. Chitralekha Udyan ~ ₹20)
Accessibility: Good road connectivity; city infrastructure reasonable; some attractions require walking
Guided Tours: Local guides available; heritage walks; English / Assamese
Parking: City parking available near major temples / parks
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, restaurants in Tezpur; shops; cultural centers; tea stalls
Special Notes: Tezpur known for myths (Agnigarh), ancient temples, elegant colonial era architecture

Timings: Temples & museums / tanks are open daylight
Entry Fee: Many heritage sites are free / nominal fee; museums / Ahom monuments may charge small fees
Accessibility: Town roads decent; monuments often centrally located; walking required for some
Guided Tours: Yes – local history guides; academic/cultural tours
Parking: Available in town; near heritage sites / temples
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, restaurants, shops; local markets; cultural events
Special Notes: Sivasagar was capital of Ahom Kingdom; has famous Rang Ghar, Talatal Ghar, Joysagar Tank etc

Timings: Open year-round; attractions open daylight hours
Entry Fee: Not applicable (free to visit town / hills; parks may charge small nominal fee)
Accessibility: Hill roads; limited wheelchair accessibility; trekking paths for nearby viewpoints
Guided Tours: Local guides available for trekking / sightseeing
Parking: Available in town centre and at viewpoints
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, hotels, guesthouses; restaurants; local markets
Special Notes: Assam’s only hill station; known as “Switzerland of the East”

Timings: 7:00 AM – 4:00 PM (daily; closed during heavy monsoon)
Accessibility: Road till park entry; inside areas accessible by boat safaris & walking trails; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Yes – boat tours with naturalists; birdwatching guides available
Nearby Amenities: Eco camps, lodges near Guijan & Tinsukia; local eateries and rest houses
Special Notes: Known for feral horses, migratory birds, and rich biodiversity; part of Brahmaputra floodplain ecosystem

Entry Fee: Free entry in some gardens; guided tours chargeable (~₹200–₹500)
Accessibility: Well-paved roads to most gardens; internal paths easy; wheelchair access possible in some estates
Guided Tours: Yes – tea estate tours include plantation walks, tea factory visits, tasting sessions
Parking: Available in estates; free or included in tour fee
Nearby Amenities: Heritage tea bungalows (converted into resorts); restaurants; shops selling Assam Tea
Special Notes: Dibrugarh is called the “Tea City of India”; offers tea tasting, heritage bungalows, Assamese & British colonial culture

Nearest Airport: Tezpur Airport (~125 km); Guwahati Airport (~180 km)
Accessibility: Well-connected by road & rail; within town; not fully wheelchair-friendly inside old structures
Guided Tours: Local priests and cultural guides explain Satra history
Nearby Amenities: Guesthouses in Hojai; local restaurants; shops
Special Notes: Birthplace of Srimanta Sankardev; hub of Assamese Vaishnavism

Nearest Bus Stand: Guwahati Bus Terminals (~50 km); Marigaon bus stand (~30 km)
Accessibility: Road from Guwahati to Pobitora is good; internal safaris by jeep; not wheelchair-friendly
Guided Tours: Yes – official guides with jeep safaris; English/Hindi/Assamese support
Parking: Available at entry gate; nominal charge
Nearby Amenities: Eco lodges, homestays; tea stalls; basic eateries
Special Notes: High density of one-horned rhinos; birdwatcher’s paradise; smaller & less crowded than Kaziranga

Nearest Railway Station: Jorhat Town Railway Station (~20 km + ferry)
Nearest Bus Stand: Jorhat ASTC Bus Stand (~20 km + ferry)
Accessibility: Requires ferry from Jorhat; local roads in Majuli
Parking: Available near ferry point / satra area
Special Notes: Founded in 1653, one of Majuli’s most important satras, known for traditional dance & cultural heritage

Accessibility: Road access good; walking trails inside forest
Special Notes: Only sanctuary in India dedicated to Hoolock Gibbons; also home to elephants, leopards, and birdlife

Type: Historical Monument / Scenic Hill / Cultural Heritage
Accessibility: Hilltop park with steps; moderate difficulty for elderly
Guided Tours: Not official, but local guides narrate legends
Special Notes: Associated with the legend of Usha & Aniruddha (Mahabharata); scenic view of Brahmaputra River

Type: Scenic Hill Station / River Valley / Industrial Tourism
Nearest Bus Stand: Haflong / Diphu ASTC Bus Stands (~100 km)
Timings: Open year-round (restricted zones inside dam area)
Guided Tours: Local guides for hill treks & cultural villages
Special Notes: Surrounded by green hills, lakes & waterfalls; Karbi culture hub

Nearest Railway Station: Guwahati Railway Station (~4 km from ferry ghat)
Accessibility: Accessible only by ferry from Uzan Bazar Ghat
Nearby Amenities: Shops, eateries at riverbank; hotels in Guwahati city
Special Notes: Smallest inhabited river island in the world; famous for Umananda Temple (Lord Shiva)
